description: Need new version 2.6

this is version 1.0, a very very old version, WSJTX is ovr version 2 now. Do not install this version, it doesnt have Ft8 or MSK144. This one is incompatible with what everyone is using in 2019 and onward...

Sorry I can;t recommend a different ARM build for this software, It; is difficult to build yourself, not on a windows machine,

this crummy GUI (Discover on KDe) wont let me give 1 star, or negative stars, so two stars is a lie

again - DO NOT INSTALL THIS VERSION
A great Ham radio app for FT8 etc.
summary: A Great digital ham radio app

description:
Currently working on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS

Cannot state any further as I am a light user.
Seems to work OK for me!
I have used this on Ubuntu 16 with success and also have the Windows version which I currently use on another PC. I simply cannot get this load to launch in 18,04.04 LTS. it is hugely disappointing.
summary: It will not launch on 18.04.04 LTS

description: Running Ubuntu 16 on old windows XP laptop (dual boot) and an older Kenwood TS-570D. Had some issues with getting the USB ports to work properly. For whatever reason, for the PTT to function correctly, had to physically swap the USB connectors. It wanted the PTT USB to be TTYUSB1 and not TTYUSB0. But everything is working now EXCEPT it is not reporting spots via the internet. Can't seem to figure that one out. Might have to setup a python script to automatically upload the logs every once in a while. Not bad for a Linux Newbie.
summary: Works (mostly) on old windows XP laptop

description: Does not run on Ubuntu 20.04LTS. Program's output audio does not go to any system audio device so far as I can tell. Input audio locks after attempted output.
Running wsjt-x kills my audio set up and I have to reboot to get audio working again. Also, I cannot get USB audio to/from my FT991A.

WSJTX 2.3.0 provides FST4 and FST4W for 137 and 475 kHz. The older 2.2.2 gives FT4. Here we get only 2.1.2

WSJT-X 2.4.0 releases its rc2 for beta testers.

For one who would like to build from the source, I can tell you that newly optimized .f90 files have fewer warnings emitted from the compiler.

Visit the author page for details.
Version 1.1 is decades obsolete. I have tried 2.3.0. and 2.4.0 but wont launch on ubuntu 18.
summary: Why not get 2.4.0, Ver 1.1 is years obsolete

summary: UM20.04.2 Fatal Error.  "Failed to find SQLite Qt Driver"

description: do not waste time with Ubuntu for hamradio

Worked for me right out the box with almost no setup for MSK144. Got told to fire it up , Aug 13 2020, because it was pretty busy. Saw W5EME calling out less then 10 minutes later.

Was easy to pick out my audio source for my Rig Blaster too.
I like. Simple. Maybe too simple for hard core weak sig guys.
Very early version of app. Would be nice if it were updated and wsjtx-z was also included.
Version 2.7.0 from Fedora repo is a pre-release beta which stops functioning after September 2023 ! The Flathub repo has version 2.6.1 which works (in April 2024).

Works without problems. Please update here to a new version!
Thanks!
summary: please update to a newer version

description:
the first distro in which I found JS8CALL WSJTX FLRIG FLDIGI etc. in the latest high current version. Unbelievable. as if it was made for amateur radio.
ok FLrig and Fldigi can also be found, but hopelessly outdated.
Una aplicación con todos los elementos requeridos para modos digitales en hamradio.
ca splm:fdd vbt,ifkhog
